message_1: A concave lens has a focal length of -10 cm. If an object is placed 20 cm in front of the lens, what is the image distance and magnification?
message_2:
To find the image distance, we can use the lens formula:

1/f = 1/u + 1/v

where f is the focal length, u is the object distance, and v is the image distance.

Given the focal length f = -10 cm and object distance u = 20 cm, we can plug these values into the formula:

1/(-10) = 1/20 + 1/v

Solving for v, we get:

1/v = 1/(-10) - 1/20
1/v = -1/20

v = -20 cm

The image distance is -20 cm, which means the image is formed 20 cm in front of the lens on the same side as the object.

Now, to find the magnification, we can use the formula:

magnification = -v/u

Plugging in the values we found:

magnification = -(-20)/20
magnification = 1

The magnification is 1, which means the image is the same size as the object.
